title: Marriage Functions (Ostentatious Displays) Ordinance, 1999
description: Official consolidated text of Marriage Functions (Ostentatious Displays) Ordinance, 1999 (III of 1999) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws). Official PDF endpoint unavailable; text sourced from current public legal mirror. Source: https://nasirlawsite.com/laws/function.htm.

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title, extent and commencement
provisions.content:
--(1)
This Ordinance may be called the Marriage Functions� (Ostentatious Displays)
Ordinance, 1999.
(2)
It extends to the whole of Pakistan .
(3)
It shall come into force at once and shall
remain in force for a period of two years from its commencement.

provisions.title: Section 2. Interpretations
provisions.content:
--For the purposes of
this Ordinance the expression �marriage� shall include all ceremonies,
preceding and succeeding the formal wedding, whether religious or civil rituals
such as nikah, rukhsati, walima, mehndi,
rasm-e-hina , and other functions and celebrations connected with marriage
and related festivities.

provisions.title: Section 3. Prohibition of ostentatious celebrations
provisions.content:
--(1)
Subject to sub-section (2), no person celebrating his marriage or the marriage
of any other person shall---
(a)
decorate or cause to be decorated any house
or building including any space appertaining thereto, street, road or other
place, whether owned by him or otherwise, with lights or illumination;
(b)
explode or allow any one to explode cracker
or other explosive device including firing by fire-arm; or
(c)
display or allow any one to display
fire-works.
(2) ���� Nothing contained in
sub-section (1) shall prohibit the use of such lights as are ordinarily
necessary to lit the house or any other place being the site of marriage.

provisions.title: Section 4. Restriction on wasteful expenses
provisions.content:
--(1)
No person celebrating his or the marriage of any other person shall serve or
allow any one to serve meals or other edibles to the persons participating in
the marriage in a club, hotel, restaurant, weeding hall, community centre or
any other public place, except hot and cold soft drinks.
(2) ���� Nothing contained in
sub-section (1) shall apply to the eating of meals within the house by the
members of family celebrating the marriage or the house guests.

provisions.title: Section 5. Application of the Ordinance to hotels,
provisions.content:
restaurants, etc. ---No person owning or running a hotel, restaurant,
wedding hall, community centre, or club being the site of a marriage ceremony
or any caterer shall serve or allow any one to serve any meals or edibles to
the persons participating in the marriage ceremony other than hot and cold soft
drinks.

provisions.title: Section 6. Offences
provisions.content:
--Whoever contravenes the
provisions of Section 3, Section 4 or Section 5 shall be guilty of an offence
punishable with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month or
with fine which shall not be less than one hundred thousand rupees and not more
than five hundred thousand rupees or with both.

provisions.title: Section 7. Cognizance of offences
provisions.content:
--(1) The
offences under this Ordinance shall be non-cognizable and no Court shall take
cognizance of an offence under this Ordinance except on a complaint in writing
by an officer or agency as the Federal Government or a Provincial Government
may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.
(2)
No Court
inferior to that of the Magistrate of the first class shall try an offence
under this Ordinance.
(3)
Notwithstanding anything contained in section 32
of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (Act V of 1898) it shall be lawful for
any Magistrate of the first class to pass any sentence authorized by this
Ordinance even if such sentence exceeds his power under the said section 32.
